text: URL is not working, share your URL again please?

Hi , i have a big problem with a listing page created with hubdb.
My client when changing hubdb records the listing remains cached for days and days.
I tried printing the local_dt variable in an html comment but it does not change the situation.

Correct url: <https://www.sodexo.pl/lojalnosc-i-motywacja-w-biznesie/wsparcie-sprzedazy-poznaj-4-legalne-sposoby/>

The popup shows on 60% scroll

Hi Carter,

Yes, we can control response depending upon portal id but can we disable the card by following this approach?

Thank you for your feedback! :slightly_smiling_face:
<@UFURR5PM3> I actually have no idea.... super weird

Building out a webhook integration that listens to deal property changes. As part of the update on our application we need to request the associated contact with the deal which requires an API call. Since the webhooks receives requests in a bursty fashion, we’re occasionally getting rate limited. What’s the best way to mitigate this?
I’ve tried caching the calls, but if most of the webhook payloads result in a cache miss it doesn’t help much (or at all).
Hello… I’m curious, if you hook up Shopify does the contacts get enrolled as Marketing Contacts automatically by the integration? Does anyone know that?
I believe they are not set as marketing contacts by default if uploaded via API, but I’m not 100% sure on the Shopify integration

Hi everyone! Nice to meet you all! My name is Roman, I'm new to HubSpot CMS but have good expertise in web dev in general. Will be happy to talk with you about any tech things and looking forward to becoming a part of this community!
:wave: Hi everyone! Looking forward to solving problems with you all.
